newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends shade down in cautious mkt.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends shade down in cautious mkt.

text.p: * Central Bank sells $56.0 million at 26.37 pesos
The Philippine peso closed a shade lower on Tuesday at 26.369 from 26.368 as the market remained cautious of possible outflows from the stock market, dealers said.
The day's average was at 26.368 from 26.365, with volume rising to $157.7 million from $127.1 million.
"Some people are very cautious because of the selldown in the equities market," a dealer said.

The threat of a possible outflow of stock market investments had prompted the Central Bank late on Tuesday to offer reverse repos maturing on April 10 at an increased rate of 10 percent, a dealer said.
Slower inflows for fixed income securities prodded the Central Bank to increase its rate, dealers said.
Despite the rate hike, the Central Bank still had to sell about $14 million at 26.37 in afternoon trades. For the whole day, it sold a total of $56 million at 26.37, dealers estimated.
But a foreign bank dealer said the Central Bank's move on rates had already lured foreign funds to come back in the afternoon.
On Thursday, the peso is expected to be capped by the Central Bank at 26.37 if there would be outflows from stock market investments, dealers said.
One dealer said those foreign funds are believed to be currently parking short-term placements with banks.
Philippine financial markets are closed on Wednesday for a public holiday.
